title: Why was the Sacco and Vanzetti case seen as so important? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: It brought to bear that Rule of Law is the heartbeat of America and that when it is violated by prejudice, racism, and emotional vigilantism then it ceases to exist and we have anarchy and chaos. That case led to the creation of the American Civil Liberties Union. If anyone is denied justice then we all are. Justice is the last check and balance against unequal protection of the law.

Sacco and Vanzetti were anarchists. However the ballistics findings were muddled and conflicting. And , as they awaited their death sentences to be carried out, their testimony changed so many people thought there should be a re looking at the case.
